history.text: Steve Carell is great as Gru. Perfect supervillain.
What do you think about the animation genre?
I don't know how Rotten Tomatoes could give it an 81%, but CinemaScore gave it an A.
it's an excellent movie but the average rating of 6.8/10 dosen't justify to me :)
it should be rated bit higher
agreed
Do you usually watch movies that have that kind of score?
i believe the rating has both critics & normal users like us ratings
i normally go by movie trailers..
if the trailer is good...I watch it
what about you?
I generally like to watch movies in the animation genre, particularly ones produced by French studios.
gotcha...I wouldn't necessarily go by movie studios but my general observation is....disney's, dreamworks & studio ghibli movies are excellent
Any movie where the main character is described as a megalomaniacal rogue has to be good!
by the way...do you know if this movie directors made other animation movies?
No, this was his feature debut film.

lol i never check who directs/casts the movies in general
....
ok
My favorite part was when Gru had to get a bank loan. What NAICS code would that go under?
what's NAICS code? Not sure of this
It's probably not a thing in a move where you are shrinking the moon, with a name like the Bank Of Evil.
lol :)
so do you agree with critics responses on the movie?
"Kids will dig it, adults will smile with amusement, and no one will be any different afterward than they were walking into the theater
For the most part. I do agree that it is a different type of movie from Pixar.
I atleast do not agree with 'and no one will be any different afterward than they were walking into the theater.'...part
atleast I was smiling for a whole lot time after watching the movie
& I had some arguments with my wife even now as we chat
It was sad how Dr. Nefario (great name BTW) tried to get the girls to back to the orphanage. Broke my heart.
well a movie has to have mixed emotions

this way viewers always stay focussed on what
 might happen
I'm surprised he didn't stick to his minions. If I had minions, I'd use them for all sorts of crazy stuff, like stealing the moon.
may be thaey are just a comedy element & most of the time Gru & family SAVIOURS
i like the way emotions were shown for the 3 adopted girls
it gives a message how important a family is...so kids have something to learn atleast while having fun
I agree. They did a good job with the contrast of wanting to leave them at an amusement part to adopting them.
i also like how science was incorporated into a fictitious movie
well as an adult most knew moon cannot be shrinked but the portrayal was very genuine & seems natural
Right? I wonder if the temporary effect of the shrink ray is real. I may need to invent one and find out for my self. NO Bank of Evil for me to go to though...
it's such elements that raise goose bumps
I also like how the minions saved the girls, risking their own lives to do it.
Speaking of science, I wonder if Vector died while on the moon, or he is still living up there in a cartoon induced atmosphere.
do you know what happened after vector got strapped to the moon & it was launched into an orbit?
I dont remember
Me either.
